content: since the world has gone a haywire recently and we are all stressed and easily distracted i thought a simple project made of small quick pieces would be beneficial hence the blanket of calm once you get the hang of these granny squares you will be able to do one in a matter of minutes they are very soothing to do and can help you ease your nerves in the coming week i will add directions on how to join the squares for your blanket guess what there is no seaming involved there is an accompanying video link on pattern page in ravelry that i made to help you understand how to do these if you are new to crochet do not be intimidated if you can knit then you can do these granny squares and by the time this madness is over you will have a beautiful blanket materials fingering weight scrap yarn approximately 12 yards/3 grams per square please note that if you use single plied yarn mixed with plied yarn your squares may differ in size from each other each square is approximately 3 x 3 but this isn t that important it s more important for each square to be the same size so you will get a rectangular blanket 42 x 51 requires 238 squares 14 squares wide x 17 squares long 51 x 63 requires 357 squares 17 squares wide x 21 squares long crochet hook i used a size d but you may want to experiment and since i know that none of you will do a gauge i ll just leave that out the blanket of calm casapinka 1 abbreviations chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet in uk/ireland/aus/nz etc double_crochet- double_crochet treble_crochet in uk/ireland/aus/nz etc cs corner sequence done for every corner in this pattern 2dc into same space chain 2 2 double_crochet into same space sts - stitches begin square make a loop ch4 then place hook into first chain yo and pull through both sts first round 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet into center of loop 2 chain 2 3 double_crochet into center of loop work row 2 two more times then ch3 and join with 3rd link in chain from row 1 join by putting hook through the link yarn over then pull yarn through both sts on your hook you should have what looks like a small flower with 4 spaces in each corner second round 1 ch3 double_crochet into next 2 sts note first double_crochet is very close to your ch3 corner sequence cs 2 double_crochet into next 3 sts cs work row 2 two more times 3 join to third link of ch3 from row 1 and pull through as described in first round third round 1 ch3 double_crochet into next 4 sts cs 2 double_crochet into next 7 sts cs work row 2 two more times 3 double_crochet into next 2 sts 4 join to top of ch3 from row 1 and pull through
